name: Gloria Palace Amadores Thalasso & Hotel

reviews.text: This is the place to go with little kids if you want relaxation around the pool and "not to see too much"!
reviews.title: Great place for families w/ small kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled to Gloria Palace with out 4,5 months old daughter. Our goal was to relax in the sun for a one week and not to do anything.
reviews.title: Gloria Palace - great value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gloria Palace was great for this experience! We had been placed on the reception level on a large room (normal standard at Amadores!) and room was equiped with a baby bed etc. It was great for them to have this considered.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

likes.disliked: — slow lifts and not enough in the main areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our trip included all inclusive package which also was great for our purposses. No half eaten dishes in a far away restaurant left behind... Food on buffet & lunch was ok (You always good find something good), wine included in ~ drinkable, bar fine with all the coctails.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: We didn't spend almost any money on our one week stay!
reviews.title: I just keep going back

likes.liked: — location and each room has a sea view
likes.disliked: — all inclusive drinks finished at midnight

reviews.title: Large, clean, modern sea front hotel for the masses
reviews.text: Check in (at 2pm) was quick and painless, found room easily enough (and there's a lot of them!). My room - 4051A - was ok, large, bigger than a standard-class room in the UK. Large bathroom (no bath - just a good drench shower).

reviews.title: will return to the gloria palace
reviews.text: Booked on half-board, food in this 4* hotel is better than average. Wide selection of hot and cold food, with a section where they cook steaks, carve roast sirloin, cook curry and fried rice etc etc. Good selection of sweets. Coffee not available though - has to be ordered in the bar. There is no set seating plan - just find a table, where a waiter will take your drinks order. Arrive early to avoid the stampede. Breakfast has a good selection as well - likewise, arrive early to beat the rush. If you want breakfast after 9 it's like a scrum. If you are on your own take a jumper to bag your place - otherwise forget about keeping it if you get up to get some more food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is quite large - probably houses 1000 people when full - and is fine if you want to never see the island. The 2 pools are well sized, warm (in January!) and there's a nude bathing area. The spa is okay - a bit of a gimmick, and a bit on the pricey side, but okay for a treat when you're away.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best bits? The quality and quantity of food, the location, the good sized rooms, cleanliness of the hotel.
reviews.title: First 2 weeks were heaven third... well.....

reviews.text: The worst bits? Painfully slow lifts, evening entertainment, poor bar staff (didn't know much about cocktails, had to practically shout to get noticed)
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
brilliant place
reviews.text: Just back from Gloria Palace, had a wonderful time. Hotel is just fantastic, staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms are a great size and clean. View of sunset every evening form balcony is amazing. Pools there are very clean and a joy to get into, over looking the sea. Waiting staff in the bar are quite slow in returning change so better to go up to the bar and order yourself.

reviews.title: Brilliant!!

reviews.text: Sangria by the pool is fantastic too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Spectacular, Wonderful, Fabulous.....
reviews.text: Had a wonderful time and met really nice people - If you are reading this Hi to Tracey and Neil, lovely to met you both, keep in touch, please consider meeting us there at christmas!!!!

reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel!!
reviews.text: My partner and I booked a last minute deal with Thomas Cook here in June 2006 half board. We were a bit unsure having read some of the reviews "2 star not 4" etc but boy were they wrong - I think they must have gone to a completely different hotel!!!

ROOM: When we arrived at 2.00am we got our room and it was HUGE! Very large room with a sofa and seating area and the balcony was just as big - complete private sun trap from 3-6pm overlooking the sea - heaven. The bathroom was all tiled and had his and hers vanity units large bath and toilet slightly seperate - one let down no bidet which is unusual for Spain but that was it - there was aircon.
reviews.title: nice sunny break

reviews.text: FOOD: Oh my goodness - we have travelled quite a bit and we decided this was the second best hotel for food we had ever stayed - for breakfast there was anything you wanted - fresh fruit, cereal, yoghurt, full english cooked how you wanted, pastries, pate - on Sundays they do smoked salmon and champagne as well its wonderful. Also there were every kind of tea you could want Earl Grey, herbals, fruits amazing. Only thing we would say is that it definitely got busier the last couple of days we were there so go either late or early otherwise seating is a problem.
reviews.title: Dissappointing - wasn't as good as it looked!
Sunshine!
reviews.text: Dinner was just as amazing - I am quite fussy - don't eat red meat etc but I put on over half a stone - there was soup, salad galore, dressings, pasta salad, cheeses, pate's, fresh veg, then your hot dishes (which were always very hot!) such as chicken fish plenty to choose from, then as well as normal choice there was always a theme so Mexican one night then Italian etc and then there was the food cooked right in front of you how you wanted steak every night fish salmon pork (usually 3 options each night)- there were chips and the best "chippy gravy" you have ever tasted in your life. Deserts just as good choice of many cakes fruit ice cream sorbet cheese and biscuits. The evening meal is waiter service for drinks and self serve at breakfast - we put our drinks on room and paid at end - much easier than messing about with cash and change etc.

LOCATION: the location of this hotel is just the best in Puerto Rico. You go down two glass lifts from reception and onto a lovely walkway by the sea. Turn left and this takes you to Puerto Rico - literally a 5 minute walk to the lovely beach harbour shops bars etc - turn right and you walk 10 mins to a truly beautiful beach called Amadores - crystal clear blue water lovely soft sand. Sun loungers are 2.5 euros per person per day - not as many bars etc at Amadores but quieter. Boat trips go from the harbour at Puerto Rico. the glass lift doors at the hotel shut at 11.30 at night and you would prob need a taxi back after then as its very steep - its safe as you have to use your door key to get in.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

description: Located between the beaches of Puerto Rico and Amadores, Gloria Palace Amadores Thalasso & Hotel is built on a cliff top and integrated into the landscape, providing spectacular views over the ocean from all parts of the hotel. Built in 2004, the hotel boasts one of Europe’s best equipped thalassotherapy centres. In just a few years, the elegant surroundings and top class, friendly service have made it one of the most popular hotels on the Island.
